Title: Nigerian lawyers, tech gurus to discuss access to justice in the age of AI
Summary: Dozens of Nigerian tech enthusiasts, lawyers, and academicians will gather in Abuja next week . They will discuss issues at the intersection of access to justice, digital technology, and artificial intelligence in legal practices across the country . The participants will gather at the Abuja airport .

Title: BBNaija season 10: Organisers announces dates, states for audition
Summary: The organisers of Big Brother Naija have confirmed that auditions for the 10th edition of the show will kick off online from May 3 to May 7, 2025 . Physical auditions to follow shortly after .

Title: ‘Two million’ throng Lady Gaga concert at Rio’s Copacabana
Summary: Lady Gaga rocked Rio de Janeiro’s Copacabana Beach with a free mega-concert that the Brazilian city said drew about two million fans . “Brazil, I missed you so much,” screamed the American pop star — in her first Brazil .

Title: UK expands centres as Nigeria accounts for 6% of global visa demand
Summary: UK expands centres as Nigeria accounts for 6% of global visa demand . Nigeria accounted for six percent of all global UK visit visas in 2024 . UK Minister of State at the Home Office, David Hanson, disclosed the data .

Title: UK-based man accused of killing minor with Samurai swords pleads not guilty
Summary: Marcus Arduini Monzo is accused of murdering 14-year-old Daniel Anjorin and attacking four others with two Japanese swords . Monzo has denied the allegation .

Title: NDLEA uncovers drugs hidden in chocolate tins, seizes N3.4bn worth of opioids
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency intercepted three million, five hundred thousand (3,500,000) pills of opioids and one hundred and sixty-three thousand bottles of codeine syrup with a combined street value of over N3.42billion . The drugs were found in Port Harcourt, Rivers state and Lagos state .

Title: Four seminarians die in fatal crash at Obudu Ranch
Summary: Four seminarians are said to have died in a bus crash at the Ikwete village at the Obudu Ranch Bottom Hill, in Obanlikwu Local Government Area of Cross River State .

Title: Road Safety: VIS impounds over 200 rickety Danfo, other vehicles in Lagos
Summary: Lagos State Vehicle Inspection Service impounds over 200 unroadworthy vehicles . The operation is aimed at improving road safety and reducing accidents caused by faulty vehicles . VIS has impounded over 200 rickety Danfo, other vehicles .

Title: Opposition-backed cabal plotting emergency rule in Zamfara — Shinkafi
Summary: Former Chairman of the Anti-Banditry Committee in Zamfara State, Alhaji Sani Abdullahi Shinkafi, has alleged a plot by an opposition-backed cabal to destabilize the state and push for the declaration of a state of emergency .

Title: Kalu, Anyim, Nnamani, Dogara urge ex-legislators to safeguard democracy
Summary: Kalu, Anyim, Nnamani, Dogara urge ex-legislators to safeguard democracy . Current and former lawmakers in Nigeria have called on ex-lawmakers to actively safeguard democracy and ensure it stays true to its foundational values and principles .

Title: Oyo signs N3.5bn contract to upgrade rural markets
Summary: Oyo State Rural Access and Agricultural Marketing Project has awarded contracts worth N3.5 billion for the first phase of physical improvement and remodelling of three markets across the state . The three markets selected are Aare-Alasa Market, Akanran area, Ona-Ara Local Government, Oja-Agbe Market,

Title: Ex-Wema boss urges deeper engagement to sustain bank’s legacy
Summary: Ex-Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of Wema Bank Plc, Ademola Adebise, urged the management of the bank to pursue deeper and more structured engagement . He gave this advice at the second reunion and celebration of bank’s 80th anniversary, tagged Oluyole 2025, with the theme:

Title: How US Yoruba village sparked row between Alaafin, Ooni
Summary: The seeming rift came to public attention on Tuesday, April 29, when the Alaafin refused to stand up to greet the Ooni at a programme organised by Nigeria’s First Lady, Oluremi Tinubu, in Ibadan, Oyo State . In a video that went viral on social media, the Ala

Title: Lagos impounds over 200 vehicles for failing safety tests
Summary: The Lagos State Vehicle Inspection Service has impounded over 200 unroadworthy vehicles across the state . The Director of Lagos VIS, Mr Akin-George Fashola, stated this in a press release made available to the News Agency of Nigeria on Sunday . The initiative was aimed at enhancing road safety and reducing accidents caused by unfit vehicles

Title: Tech helping us fight cybercrime, sexual violence — Lagos CP
Summary: Olohundare Jimoh reaffirmed commitment to leveraging technology in crime prevention and prosecution, particularly in tackling cybercrime and sexual and gender-based violence . The Lagos State Commissioner of Police said rape and defilement cases were among the easiest to prove scientifically, “provided they are reported promptly,” Jimoh asserted .
